dialogues.text: Ah, a brave soul! I need rare herbs for a potion. Can you retrieve them?
dialogues.info: Gather rare herbs for the Wizard. Reward: +{number} HP.

option1.response: The Wizard nods. 'Excellent! They grow deep in the forest.'

option2.response: The Wizard frowns. 'Time waits for no one, adventurer.'

option3.response: The Wizard explains, 'This potion can heal even the gravest wounds.'

dialogues.text: I found this strange trinket. Care to buy it for {number1} gold?
dialogues.info: Pay {number1} gold for a trinket that grants +{number2} HP.

option1.response: You pay the Villager, who hands you the trinket.

option3.response: The Villager says, 'I hear it protects against harm.'

dialogues.text: I saw a strange creature by the river. If you slay it, I’ll share my findings!
dialogues.info: Kill the creature by the river. Reward: Potion (+{number} damage).

option1.response: The Beggar nods eagerly. 'Return to me once the creature is slain!'

option2.response: The Beggar looks disappointed. 'Ah, well. It was worth asking.'

option3.response: The Beggar says, 'It’s a big, ugly thing—green scales, sharp teeth!'

dialogues.text: My pickaxe broke! If you bring me another, I’ll share a treasure I dug up.
dialogues.info: Deliver a pickaxe to the Miner. Reward: +{number} gold.

option1.response: The Miner grins. 'You’re a lifesaver! Here’s your reward.'

option2.response: The Miner sighs. 'I guess I’ll have to wait a bit longer.'

option3.response: The Miner explains, 'I can't keep working without one. I’ve got precious finds to dig up!'

dialogues.text: The dragon threatens my kingdom! Slay its minions, and I’ll make you a knight!
dialogues.info: Kill 3 dragon minions. Reward: Knight title (increas HP by {number}).

option1.response: The King smiles. 'You have my blessing, brave warrior!'

option2.response: The King nods solemnly. 'I understand, but my kingdom will be in peril.'

option3.response: The King grimaces. 'The dragon’s minions are terrorizing my people. We need a hero like you.'

dialogues.text: I have gold to spare. Bring me dragon scales, and I’ll pay you handsomely.

option1.response: The Queen nods. 'I will await your return with the scales.'

option2.response: The Queen's expression hardens. 'I see. It seems the scales are too much to ask for.'

option3.response: The Queen explains, 'Dragon scales are rare and valuable. They can be sold or crafted into powerful items.'

dialogues.text: Welcome, traveler! Rest here for {number1} gold and restore your health.

option1.response: The Innkeeper takes your gold and hands you a warm bed. 'Rest well, traveler.'

option2.response: The Innkeeper nods. 'If you change your mind, the bed is ready.'

option3.response: The Innkeeper smiles. 'This place has been serving travelers for years. A good place to rest your weary bones.'

dialogues.text: My forge is cold. Bring me coal, and I’ll craft you a weapon.

option1.response: The Blacksmith nods. 'Good, I’ll need a lot of coal to get my forge working again.'

option2.response: The Blacksmith looks disappointed. 'A cold forge is no good to anyone, but I understand.'

option3.response: The Blacksmith grunts. 'I need a large amount of coal to heat up the forge and start working. Can you gather it for me?'

dialogues.text: You look weak! Prove yourself worthy of my treasure!

option1.response: The Orc roars in anger. 'You’ll regret this!'

option2.response: The Orc laughs cruelly. 'Fleeing now? Pathetic!'

option3.response: The Orc grins wickedly. 'If you survive, you’ll find it among my spoils.'

dialogues.text: The dragon sent me to stop you. Prepare to fight!

option1.response: The Knight raises his sword. 'This will be your final battle!'

option2.text: Try to talk your way out
option2.response: The Knight laughs. 'Words won't save you, fool!'

option3.response: The Knight grins. 'Coward. You’ll regret running.'

dialogues.text: The dragon has a bounty on your head. Time to collect!

option1.response: The Assassin moves swiftly. 'You won’t last long.'

option2.response: The Assassin laughs. 'You think you can escape me?'

option3.response: The Assassin smirks. 'The dragon’s always watching. Your death is inevitable.'
